welcome.title: Hey, I am an infobox!
welcome.content: Info boxes provide information on the current phase of the project. You will always find them in the bottom right-hand corner, foldable with the i

scrum_roles.title: Scrum Roles
scrum_roles.content:
There are three main roles in a Scrum team:
 {roles} The Product Owner defines requirements and prioritises tasks. The Scrum Master ensures compliance with the Scrum process and removes obstacles. The development team implements the requirements and delivers functional products in sprints.

role.title: What's your role?
role.description: Choose your role so that ScrumpliCity can be tailored to you!

login.error: An error occured while logging in.

editorial_policy.title: Editorial Policy
editorial_policy.content: Teaching the fundamentals of the Scrum agile project management method through interactive exercises and hands-on projects.

disclaimer.title: Disclaimer
disclaimer.content: This website was developed as part of a thesis project and is intended for use in various educational institutions. While the content has been created with utmost care, the project team assumes no liability for the accuracy, completeness, or timeliness of the information. The use of the website and materials is at the user's own risk.

business_purpose.title: Business Purpose
business_purpose.content: Development of a platform as part of a thesis project to teach the Scrum method through interactive group exercises and projects.

planning.write_user_story: Then write your first user story!
planning.title: Title
planning.story_points_of_planned_user_stories: Story points of the planned user stories

sprint_names.title: Sprint names
sprint_names.content: Sprint names help to clearly identify sprints and categorize them in a meaningful way. For example, they can be named numerically (e.g. "Sprint 1", "Sprint 2"), according to content focus (e.g. "Sprint house construction") or with a further alphabetical initial letter (e.g. "Amsterdam", "Berlin").

sprint_goal.title: Sprint Goal
sprint_goal.content: The sprint goal is the main objective that the team wants to achieve in the current sprint. It provides clear orientation and helps to keep the focus on the most important things during the entire sprint. A good sprint goal is precise, realistic and clear to the entire team, e.g. "Sketch the layout of the city."

user_stories.title: User stories
user_stories.content: User stories should be formulated clearly and precisely and reflect the user's perspective. They follow the format: "As a [role], I want [goal] to [benefit]." (e.g. "As a resident, I would like to have a road to get from my house to work.") Acceptance criteria should also be present. These are conditions that show when a task has been completed. (e.g. "The road has two lanes.")

story_points.title: Story points
story_points.content: Story points indicate the complexity of the user story. The Fibonacci sequence (1, 2, 3, 5, 8, 13 ...) is often used to record relative differences between the stories. Alternative estimation methods for user stories are T-shirt sizes (S, M, L, XL) or time-based estimation.

homepage.project_description: Learn the agile project management method Scrum by building a paper city! ScrumpliCity provides a web application, crafting templates and explanations about Scrum—so:

learn_scrum.title: Learn Scrum
learn_scrum.description: Discover the basics of Scrum and start your first agile project—practical, interactive and easy to understand!

craft_your_city.title: Craft your city
craft_your_city.description: Design your own paper city and bring your project to life step by step!

solidify_teamwork.title: Solidify teamwork
solidify_teamwork.description: Strengthen team spirit and experience how effective, cooperative collaboration can lead your projects to success!

homepage.all_you_need_to_know: Scrum: All you need to know!
homepage.scrum_guide_description: You would like to learn more about the agile project management method Scrum outside of the game process? You'll find everything you need on our Scrum theory page: from the basics to practical tips. Whether you're new to Scrum or want to deepen your knowledge, you'll find clear, understandable explanations here. Take a look and take your projects to the next level!
